A Little About Myself

Hi, my name is Safran and I’m a fourth year computer science major student. Throughout my degree I have worked on a variety of projects and developed a passion for front-end dev using various industry standard frameworks. I am most skilled in: react and Mantine

Projects

Database Project

This was one of the first group project that I worked on and I learned a lot about working in a team and using databases.

This project was part of my third year course work in COMP 3380, and was a group project with 2 other students. We were tasked with creating a database, and also had to create an interface to interact with the database. I was responsible for the adjustments and modifications of the terminal interface, and I also used my knowledge of SQL to create the database, populate it with data and make interesting queries.

Human Computer Interaction Project

The very first project that introduced me to the world of front-end development and react, and it was love at first sight.

This was part of my third year course work in COMP 3020, and we were tasked with creating an interactive library that employed gestalt principles to reduce friction between human and computer. Being the lead front-end developer with the highest number of commit contributions, I was responsible for creating the interface using react and make it come to life. Some of the particular components that I created were the search bar, navigation arrows and feedback driven animations throughout the interface.

Software Engineering 1 Project

Software Engineering 1 was a great course that taught me a lot about working in a team and using agile methodologies.

This was part of my third year course work in COMP 3350, and we were tasked with creating an Android application using Android Studio. The application that we picked was about food recipes, and part of my responsibilities included creating the front-end component of creating a recipe and viewing a recipe. I also worked on the back-end component of the application, which included creating a database, adding images and connecting it to the front-end. I was also part of testing and was responsible for creating test cases for unit, integration and acceptance tests and testing the application.

Software Engineering 2 Project (Current Project)

Taking my software engineering skills to the next level, I am currently working on a project that is much more complex.

This is part of my fourth year course work in COMP 4350, and my team is tasked with creating a web application. For this one, we have picked to create a brand-new social media platform that is based on the idea of having close knit communities. I am the second lead front-end developer and I am responsible for creating multiple components of the interface. I am using react as our core framework for front-end development, and for components I have worked extensively with the Mantine library. I have also worked with Formik for form handling, yup for schema validations, and I am also responsible for integrating the back-end component of the application using various AWS services like Amplify, Lambda, AppSync, DynamoDB, CloudWatch.

Experience

Vital Statistics Manitoba

Administrative Clerk

January 2022 - May 2023

vitalstats.gov.mb.ca/

As an Administrative Clerk at Vital Statistics, I have honed my skills in managing computer databases, ensuring the up-to-date maintenance of client information. My responsibilities extend to performing a variety of clerical duties, such as processing event certificates and managing stationary inventories. I have also assisted in accessing and maintaining the confidential information vault, working closely with the manager to fulfill archival and daily operational requirements of the branch.

Sobeys Bakery

Front End Associate

August 2021 - January 2022

sobeys.com/stores/sobeys-pembina/

During my tenure as a Front End Associate at Sobeys Bakery from August 2021 to January 2022, I focused on delivering exceptional customer service, tailoring experiences to meet individual needs. My role involved collaborating with other departments to enhance the shopping environment and handling a variety of baked and retail goods for display. Working alongside the assistant manager and manager, I contributed to ensuring the department’s operational needs were met daily.

Manitoba Health

Documentation Clerk

November 2020 - April 2021

gov.mb.ca/health/

In my role as a Documentation Clerk for Manitoba Health from November 2020 to April 2021, I was tasked with maintaining the smooth operation of multiple branches through diligent documentation and database management. I efficiently sorted and managed client paperwork, processed a wide range of insurance claims, and prioritized daily responsibilities in collaboration with the manager and supervisor. This position allowed me to develop a keen attention to detail and a strong sense of organization.

Starbucks

Barista

September 2019 - March 2020

starbucks.ca/

As a Barista at Starbucks from September 2019 to March 2020, I committed myself to maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction through effective communication and active listening. I managed various client service operations, including cash handling and inventory management, to ensure the seamless delivery of service. My proactive approach to inventory prediction and collaboration with supervisors and managers enabled me to contribute meaningfully to the company’s goals and adapt to a diverse range of situations.

Education

University of Manitoba

BSc Computer Science

2019 - Current

Established in 1877, University of Manitoba is one of the oldest higher education institution in Canada and has a strong research focus with a Nobel Prize winning faculty.
